content:
AI-900 Mockup Tests

Use these mock tests to reinforce your understanding of Azure AI Fundamentals concepts. Each mini-assessment focuses on a specific exam objective and includes answer explanations.

Responsible AI Principles

Evaluate how Azure services help organizations apply responsible AI principles across fairness, reliability, privacy, and inclusiveness.

  • 10 scenario-based questions
  • Instant answer review
  • Reference links for further study

Azure Machine Learning Workflow

Review the stages of the machine learning lifecycle, from data preparation through model deployment and monitoring.

  • 12 multiple-choice questions
  • Hands-on lab recommendations
  • Exam tips and key takeaways

Applied AI Services

Check your understanding of Azure Cognitive Services, including Vision, Language, Speech, and Decision capabilities.

  • 8 practical scenario questions
  • Sample architecture diagrams
  • Links to Microsoft Learn modules

AI-900 Practice Questions

Explore a curated collection of real exam-style questions. Expand a question to reveal the correct answer and supporting rationale pulled directly from the latest mock exam export.

Loading questions…

Back to resource index
Video companion

AI-900 Practice Test — YouTube Question Bank

This interactive practice set was generated from questions captured in the ai900fromyoutube.html export. Follow along with the companion video and expand each card to see the answers and explanations pulled from the mock exam.

  • Interactive review: Toggle each question to reveal the solution captured from the YouTube walkthrough.
  • Detailed answers: Multiple choice selections are highlighted so you can focus on the correct option.
  • Self-paced learning: Use the cards as a checklist while you pause the video and validate your understanding.

Video credit: AI-900 Practice Test on YouTube.

Loading questions…

AI-900 Practice Test — Computer Vision

1️⃣ What is the primary goal of computer vision?

  • A. To interpret and understand visual information from images or video.
  • B. To translate speech to text.
  • C. To predict future sales.
  • D. To generate marketing emails.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — To interpret and understand visual information from images or video.
Explanation: Computer vision solutions extract meaning from visual inputs so applications can reason over them. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣ Which Azure service provides prebuilt and customizable vision capabilities?

  • A. Azure AI Vision
  • B. Azure Synapse Analytics
  • C. Azure Data Explorer
  • D. Azure DevOps
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Azure AI Vision.
Explanation: Azure AI Vision delivers prebuilt models and custom vision options for analyzing images and videos. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

3️⃣ Which workload best matches image classification?

  • A. Predicting numerical values over time.
  • B. Identifying which label best describes an entire image.
  • C. Translating text between languages.
  • D. Summarizing meeting transcripts.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Identifying which label best describes an entire image.
Explanation: Image classification assigns a single category to an image from a predefined set of labels. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

4️⃣ What is object detection used for?

  • A. Detecting anomalies in time-series data.
  • B. Locating and labeling multiple objects within an image.
  • C. Recognizing spoken commands.
  • D. Generating captions from prompts.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Locating and labeling multiple objects within an image.
Explanation: Object detection models return bounding boxes and class labels for each detected object. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

5️⃣ Which scenario best fits semantic segmentation?

  • A. Classifying entire documents as spam or not.
  • B. Assigning a class label to every pixel in an image.
  • C. Translating captions into multiple languages.
  • D. Predicting website traffic.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Assigning a class label to every pixel in an image.
Explanation: Semantic segmentation provides dense labeling to show how regions of an image relate to each other. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

6️⃣ How does Azure AI Vision's Image Analysis feature help developers?

  • A. It schedules distributed training jobs.
  • B. It extracts tags, descriptions, and detected objects from images.
  • C. It encrypts data in transit.
  • D. It manages container registries.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — It extracts tags, descriptions, and detected objects from images.
Explanation: Image Analysis applies prebuilt models to understand image content without custom training. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

7️⃣ When should you use custom vision capabilities?

  • A. When prebuilt models already recognize your domain-specific objects.
  • B. When you need to train models on your own labeled images for specialized scenarios.
  • C. When you do not have any labeled image data.
  • D. When you want to translate text documents.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — When you need to train models on your own labeled images for specialized scenarios.
Explanation: Custom vision lets you upload and label data to build classification or detection models tailored to your use case. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

8️⃣ What is required to train a custom vision model in Azure?

  • A. A large language model prompt.
  • B. Labeled training images grouped into tags.
  • C. SQL stored procedures.
  • D. GPU-enabled virtual machines in the customer subscription.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Labeled training images grouped into tags.
Explanation: Custom vision services learn from labeled examples to differentiate between classes. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

9️⃣ What does Optical Character Recognition (OCR) return when analyzing an image of text?

  • A. The dominant colors in the image.
  • B. Detected text content, layout information, and bounding boxes.
  • C. A summary of the document’s key phrases.
  • D. A speech transcript of spoken words.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Detected text content, layout information, and bounding boxes.
Explanation: OCR extracts textual data and spatial location so applications can search and reuse printed or handwritten text. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

🔟 Which scenario is a good fit for Azure AI Vision Spatial Analysis?

  • A. Tracking customer sentiment on social media.
  • B. Counting people entering and exiting a retail store in real time.
  • C. Translating scanned documents.
  • D. Classifying support tickets by topic.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Counting people entering and exiting a retail store in real time.
Explanation: Spatial Analysis uses video streams to understand movements and occupancy patterns. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣1️⃣ How does object detection differ from image classification?

  • A. Detection assigns a single label to the entire image.
  • B. Detection identifies and localizes multiple objects, whereas classification labels an image as a whole.
  • C. Detection is only for grayscale images.
  • D. Detection requires no training data.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Detection identifies and localizes multiple objects, whereas classification labels an image as a whole.
Explanation: Object detection returns bounding boxes plus labels, providing richer detail than simple classification. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣2️⃣ What is a bounding box in computer vision?

  • A. A container that stores training datasets.
  • B. A rectangular region that outlines a detected object within an image.
  • C. An Azure Storage account configured for images.
  • D. A compression method for reducing image size.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — A rectangular region that outlines a detected object within an image.
Explanation: Detection algorithms output bounding boxes to describe an object's location and size. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣3️⃣ Which Azure service specializes in extracting structured data from documents using vision and language?

  • A. Azure AI Document Intelligence (Form Recognizer)
  • B. Azure Databricks
  • C. Azure Monitor
  • D. Azure VPN Gateway
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Azure AI Document Intelligence (Form Recognizer).
Explanation: Document Intelligence combines OCR and layout understanding to extract key-value pairs and tables. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣4️⃣ Why is data privacy important in computer vision scenarios?

  • A. Vision systems never capture sensitive information.
  • B. Images and videos may include personal or identifiable data that must be protected.
  • C. Compliance rules do not apply to visual data.
  • D. Privacy considerations slow model training.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Images and videos may include personal or identifiable data that must be protected.
Explanation: Responsible AI practices ensure visual data is collected, stored, and used ethically and legally. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣5️⃣ How can you deploy Azure AI Vision capabilities to run close to your data?

  • A. By using Azure AI Vision Docker containers.
  • B. By enabling Azure Active Directory.
  • C. By exporting the model to Power BI dashboards.
  • D. By converting the model to SQL views.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — By using Azure AI Vision Docker containers.
Explanation: Containers let you run Vision capabilities on-premises or at the edge while managing data locality. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣6️⃣ What insight does Azure Video Indexer provide for stored video content?

  • A. CPU usage metrics for virtual machines.
  • B. Detects faces, transcripts speech, and identifies scenes for searchable metadata.
  • C. Converts videos to spreadsheets.
  • D. Schedules build pipelines.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Detects faces, transcripts speech, and identifies scenes for searchable metadata.
Explanation: Video Indexer enriches video libraries with AI-generated insights for discovery and analysis. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣7️⃣ Which evaluation metric is especially important for object detection models?

  • A. Mean Average Precision (mAP).
  • B. Disk throughput.
  • C. Network bandwidth.
  • D. Power consumption.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Mean Average Precision (mAP).
Explanation: mAP measures how accurately the model identifies and localizes objects across confidence thresholds. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣8️⃣ How can active learning improve a computer vision model over time?

  • A. By automatically building web dashboards.
  • B. By prioritizing uncertain predictions for human review and new labels.
  • C. By increasing GPU clock speeds.
  • D. By caching API responses.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — By prioritizing uncertain predictions for human review and new labels.
Explanation: Active learning focuses labeling effort on ambiguous examples, improving accuracy with less data. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣9️⃣ Why is human oversight important in computer vision solutions?

  • A. Vision models are infallible.
  • B. Humans validate predictions, catch errors, and uphold responsible AI principles.
  • C. Oversight increases storage costs.
  • D. It eliminates the need for testing.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Humans validate predictions, catch errors, and uphold responsible AI principles.
Explanation: Human review ensures model outputs remain accurate, fair, and aligned with business rules. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣0️⃣ How should you secure keys for Azure AI Vision and custom vision resources?

  • A. Store them directly in client-side JavaScript.
  • B. Rotate and store them in secure services such as Azure Key Vault.
  • C. Share them publicly with all partners.
  • D. Check them into version control.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Rotate and store them in secure services such as Azure Key Vault.
Explanation: Protecting keys in managed secret stores reduces exposure and supports compliance requirements. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

← Back to Introduction to AI Concepts

Extract Data and Insights

Test your knowledge of Azure services that help discover information from documents and data stores.

1️⃣ Which service can analyze scanned receipts to extract totals, dates, and merchant names?

  • A. Azure Cognitive Search
  • B. Azure Form Recognizer
  • C. Azure Machine Learning
  • D. Azure Databricks
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Azure Form Recognizer.
Explanation: Form Recognizer provides prebuilt models for receipts, invoices, and other business documents, extracting key-value pairs with high accuracy. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣ Why would you enrich documents in an Azure Cognitive Search index?

  • A. To increase storage redundancy
  • B. To add AI-generated metadata such as key phrases and entities
  • C. To convert images to SVG format
  • D. To replicate the index across regions
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — To add AI-generated metadata such as key phrases and entities.
Explanation: Skillsets enrich content during indexing, creating searchable fields that surface insights from unstructured data. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

3️⃣ Which component of Azure Cognitive Search defines the schema for searchable content?

  • A. Indexer
  • B. Skillset
  • C. Index
  • D. Data source
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: C — Index.
Explanation: The index describes fields, data types, and search behavior, acting as the schema that clients query. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

4️⃣ You need to build a pipeline that ingests PDFs from Azure Blob Storage and makes them searchable. What should you configure first?

  • A. A data source pointing to the storage account
  • B. A semantic ranker
  • C. A private endpoint
  • D. Azure Synapse Link
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — A data source pointing to the storage account.
Explanation: The data source connection tells Azure Cognitive Search where to retrieve content before indexers and skillsets process the files. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

5️⃣ What advantage does Azure Synapse Analytics provide when analyzing insights extracted from AI workloads?

  • A. Built-in labeling tools for training models
  • B. Serverless SQL and Spark pools for large-scale analytics
  • C. Automatic speech translation
  • D. Managed conversational bots
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Serverless SQL and Spark pools for large-scale analytics.
Explanation: Synapse unifies big data and data warehousing, enabling teams to analyze extracted insights alongside enterprise data. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

AI-900 Practice Test — Generative AI

1️⃣ What is the primary goal of generative AI?

  • To classify data into predefined categories.
  • To generate new content such as text, images, or audio.
  • To optimize database queries.
  • To secure network traffic.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — To generate new content such as text, images, or audio.
Explanation: Generative AI models create novel outputs that resemble the patterns of the training data. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣ Which Microsoft Responsible AI principle helps ensure generative AI systems avoid causing harm?

  • Reliability & Safety
  • Performance
  • Scalability
  • Elasticity
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Reliability & Safety.
Explanation: The Reliability & Safety principle focuses on building AI systems that operate safely and predictably in real-world scenarios. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

3️⃣ Which scenario best demonstrates a generative AI workload?

  • Predicting employee attrition rates.
  • Translating medical notes to layman-friendly summaries.
  • Detecting fraudulent transactions.
  • Sorting email into spam and non-spam folders.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Translating medical notes to layman-friendly summaries.
Explanation: Generative AI transforms or produces new language outputs, such as simplified summaries of complex text. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

4️⃣ What is a foundation model in the context of generative AI?

  • A model trained for a single, narrow task.
  • A pre-trained, large-scale model adaptable to many downstream tasks.
  • A lightweight algorithm for edge devices.
  • A rule-based expert system.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — A pre-trained, large-scale model adaptable to many downstream tasks.
Explanation: Foundation models are trained on massive datasets and can be fine-tuned or prompted for diverse use cases. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

5️⃣ Which benefit does Azure OpenAI Service provide for enterprises?

  • Guaranteed open-source licensing.
  • Access to OpenAI foundation models with enterprise-grade security and compliance.
  • Local, on-device deployment only.
  • Unlimited free usage.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Access to OpenAI foundation models with enterprise-grade security and compliance.
Explanation: Azure OpenAI combines OpenAI models with Azure’s security, compliance, and regional deployment options. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

6️⃣ What is the purpose of prompt engineering?

  • Designing neural network architectures.
  • Crafting input instructions that guide the model toward desired outputs.
  • Compressing training datasets.
  • Managing cloud resource billing.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Crafting input instructions that guide the model toward desired outputs.
Explanation: Effective prompts can significantly influence the quality and accuracy of generative model responses. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

7️⃣ In text generation, what does the temperature parameter control?

  • The maximum number of output tokens.
  • The randomness and creativity of the output.
  • The network latency between regions.
  • The model’s training time.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — The randomness and creativity of the output.
Explanation: Higher temperature values encourage varied responses, while lower values make outputs more deterministic. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

8️⃣ What are tokens in the context of Azure OpenAI models?

  • API keys that authenticate requests.
  • Units of text, such as words or word pieces, processed by the model.
  • Visual image patches used by DALL·E.
  • Binary representations of security certificates.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Units of text, such as words or word pieces, processed by the model.
Explanation: Models operate on tokenized input and output, and pricing/limits are based on the number of tokens used. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

9️⃣ When would you consider fine-tuning a generative language model?

  • When you need to host the model on-premises.
  • When you require specialized terminology or tone consistent with proprietary data.
  • When you want to reduce API latency.
  • When you need to translate text between languages.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — When you require specialized terminology or tone consistent with proprietary data.
Explanation: Fine-tuning aligns the model with domain-specific language and style using additional training data. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

🔟 What role do Azure OpenAI content filters play?

  • They optimize compute usage.
  • They prevent disallowed or harmful content from being generated or returned.
  • They compress responses for faster delivery.
  • They manage user authentication.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — They prevent disallowed or harmful content from being generated or returned.
Explanation: Azure applies safety filters to enforce responsible AI standards and mitigate harmful outputs. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣1️⃣ Which type of output is DALL·E designed to produce?

  • Tabular datasets.
  • Structured JSON documents.
  • Synthetic images from text prompts.
  • Speech transcriptions.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: C — Synthetic images from text prompts.
Explanation: DALL·E models create new images that match the description provided in the prompt. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣2️⃣ Why should developers implement guardrails in generative AI applications?

  • To automatically scale compute resources.
  • To enforce business rules, safety policies, and content boundaries.
  • To store training data securely.
  • To encrypt network traffic.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — To enforce business rules, safety policies, and content boundaries.
Explanation: Guardrails apply checks before and after model calls to keep outputs within acceptable guidelines. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣3️⃣ What enables a multi-turn conversation to maintain context with a generative model?

  • Increasing the model size.
  • Passing prior conversation history as part of the prompt.
  • Storing responses in blob storage.
  • Using only the latest user message.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Passing prior conversation history as part of the prompt.
Explanation: Generative models rely on prompt input, so supplying relevant history helps maintain context and continuity. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣4️⃣ Which Azure tool helps teams build and evaluate generative AI solutions with low-code experiences?

  • Azure Logic Apps
  • Azure AI Studio
  • Azure SQL Database
  • Azure Firewall
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Azure AI Studio.
Explanation: Azure AI Studio (formerly Azure OpenAI Studio) provides playgrounds, evaluation tools, and integration options for generative AI projects. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣5️⃣ Why is it important to review generated content before publishing it to users?

  • Generative models never produce mistakes.
  • Outputs may include inaccuracies, bias, or policy violations.
  • Manual review is required for billing to occur.
  • Azure charges extra for reviewed content.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Outputs may include inaccuracies, bias, or policy violations.
Explanation: Human oversight helps ensure generated content meets quality and compliance expectations before release. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣6️⃣ What is a defining characteristic of multimodal generative models?

  • They operate only on structured data.
  • They can understand or produce more than one data type, such as text and images.
  • They are limited to on-premises deployment.
  • They require manual feature engineering.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — They can understand or produce more than one data type, such as text and images.
Explanation: Multimodal models process multiple modalities, enabling capabilities like image captioning or visual question answering. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣7️⃣ What are embeddings used for in generative AI solutions?

  • Rendering 3D graphics.
  • Converting content into numerical vectors for semantic search and similarity tasks.
  • Encrypting API responses.
  • Allocating GPU resources.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Converting content into numerical vectors for semantic search and similarity tasks.
Explanation: Embeddings capture semantic meaning, allowing applications to retrieve relevant documents or context for model prompts. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣8️⃣ Which use of generative AI would violate Azure OpenAI usage policies?

  • Drafting marketing copy for a new product.
  • Generating malware code for distribution.
  • Creating product support chatbots.
  • Translating knowledge base articles.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Generating malware code for distribution.
Explanation: Harmful or malicious use cases are prohibited by Microsoft’s responsible AI policies and will be blocked. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣9️⃣ How can teams evaluate the quality of generative AI outputs?

  • By running SQL queries on the model weights.
  • Through human review, automated metrics, and user feedback loops.
  • By monitoring CPU temperature.
  • By disabling logging.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Through human review, automated metrics, and user feedback loops.
Explanation: Evaluation combines qualitative and quantitative methods to measure accuracy, safety, and usefulness of model outputs. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣0️⃣ Why is rate limiting important when deploying generative AI APIs?

  • It reduces token costs by half.
  • It prevents abuse and protects service availability during traffic spikes.
  • It encrypts requests end-to-end.
  • It guarantees zero latency.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — It prevents abuse and protects service availability during traffic spikes.
Explanation: Rate limits and throttling help maintain reliability and fair usage of shared model resources. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣1️⃣ How should sensitive customer data be handled when customizing generative AI models?

  • Upload all data without restrictions.
  • Apply data minimization, anonymization, and access controls before use.
  • Store the data in public Git repositories.
  • Disable encryption to reduce latency.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Apply data minimization, anonymization, and access controls before use.
Explanation: Responsible AI practices require protecting personal or confidential information throughout the model lifecycle. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣2️⃣ Which Microsoft service provides a low-code interface to build conversational generative bots?

  • Microsoft Power Virtual Agents (Copilot Studio)
  • Azure Monitor
  • Azure Kubernetes Service
  • Azure Policy
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Microsoft Power Virtual Agents (Copilot Studio).
Explanation: Power Virtual Agents, now part of Microsoft Copilot Studio, lets makers integrate generative responses without extensive coding. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣3️⃣ How does a generative model differ from a discriminative model?

  • Generative models only classify inputs, while discriminative models create new content.
  • Generative models learn the joint probability of data to produce new samples; discriminative models focus on decision boundaries.
  • Discriminative models require no training data.
  • They are identical in purpose.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Generative models learn the joint probability of data to produce new samples; discriminative models focus on decision boundaries.
Explanation: Generative approaches can synthesize new examples, while discriminative models primarily categorize or predict labels. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣4️⃣ What Azure service can help monitor usage and performance of generative AI applications?

  • Azure Monitor
  • Azure Key Vault
  • Azure Policy
  • Azure Front Door
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Azure Monitor.
Explanation: Azure Monitor collects metrics, logs, and traces that provide insight into application health and usage trends. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣5️⃣ Why must you consider a model’s token limit when designing prompts?

  • Exceeding the limit changes the pricing tier.
  • Requests that exceed the limit are truncated or rejected, impacting response quality.
  • Token limits only apply to image models.
  • Token limits determine GPU allocation.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Requests that exceed the limit are truncated or rejected, impacting response quality.
Explanation: Staying within token budgets ensures the model receives full context and returns complete results. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣6️⃣ What is the difference between zero-shot and few-shot prompting?

  • Zero-shot uses no examples; few-shot includes small numbers of examples in the prompt.
  • Zero-shot requires fine-tuning; few-shot does not.
  • Few-shot is only for image generation.
  • There is no difference.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Zero-shot uses no examples; few-shot includes small numbers of examples in the prompt.
Explanation: Providing illustrative examples in a few-shot prompt can guide the model toward the desired format or tone. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣7️⃣ Which content category is evaluated by Azure AI Content Safety?

  • Battery life
  • Hate and unfair content
  • Network bandwidth
  • Storage quotas
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Hate and unfair content.
Explanation: Azure AI Content Safety detects categories such as hate, violence, sexual, and self-harm content to support responsible use. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣8️⃣ How can developers balance creativity and factual accuracy in text generation?

  • By disabling safety filters.
  • By adjusting parameters like temperature and using retrieval-augmented generation.
  • By reducing API quotas.
  • By clearing prompt history every request.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — By adjusting parameters like temperature and using retrieval-augmented generation.
Explanation: Lower temperatures produce more factual responses, and grounding prompts with trusted data increases accuracy. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣9️⃣ What should be considered when selecting a model for a generative AI solution?

  • Only the length of the model name.
  • The alignment of model capabilities with task requirements, latency, cost, and safety needs.
  • Whether the model requires SQL Server.
  • If the model can run without prompts.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — The alignment of model capabilities with task requirements, latency, cost, and safety needs.
Explanation: Model selection weighs functional fit, deployment constraints, and responsible AI considerations. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

3️⃣0️⃣ Which Azure service can orchestrate generative AI workflows using prebuilt connectors?

  • Azure Logic Apps
  • Azure DevTest Labs
  • Azure Backup
  • Azure Firewall
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Azure Logic Apps.
Explanation: Logic Apps enables low-code automation and integration of generative AI calls with other enterprise systems. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

AI-900 Practice Test — Introduction to AI Concepts

Explore the foundational AI topics assessed in the AI-900 certification. Use the module links below to drill deeper into focused workloads—Generative AI, Computer Vision, Speech, Natural Language Processing, Extracting Data and Insights, and Responsible AI—or stay on this page for a broad introduction.

Module Pages

  • Generative AI
  • Computer Vision
  • Speech Workloads
  • Natural Language Processing
  • Extract Data and Insights
  • Responsible AI

1️⃣ What best describes Artificial Intelligence (AI)?

  • A. A system that stores large amounts of data.
  • B. A system that can simulate human reasoning and behavior.
  • C. A system that runs simple predefined rules.
  • D. A database for structured data storage.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — A system that can simulate human reasoning and behavior.
Explanation: AI enables machines to perform cognitive functions like learning, reasoning, and problem solving similar to human intelligence. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣ Which of the following is an example of computer vision?

  • A. Translating text from English to French.
  • B. Detecting faces in a photograph.
  • C. Predicting customer churn.
  • D. Recognizing spoken commands.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Detecting faces in a photograph.
Explanation: Computer vision interprets and analyzes visual input like images or videos. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

3️⃣ Which Microsoft Responsible AI principle focuses on preventing discrimination?

  • A. Transparency
  • B. Fairness
  • C. Reliability & Safety
  • D. Inclusiveness
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Fairness.
Explanation: Fairness ensures AI systems treat all individuals equally without bias. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

4️⃣ What is knowledge mining used for?

  • A. Training image classification models.
  • B. Extracting insights from large volumes of unstructured data.
  • C. Translating human speech.
  • D. Detecting anomalies in numerical data.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Extracting insights from unstructured data.
Explanation: Knowledge mining uses AI to process documents, text, and images to reveal useful information. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

1️⃣1️⃣ What does “anomaly detection” help identify?

  • A. Trends in historical data.
  • B. Unusual patterns or outliers in data.
  • C. Sentiment in text documents.
  • D. Translated language pairs.

✅ Correct Answer: B — Unusual patterns or outliers in data.

1️⃣4️⃣ What does “responsible AI” mean?

1️⃣6️⃣ What is the main benefit of machine learning compared to traditional programming?

2️⃣1️⃣ Which scenario best demonstrates AI-powered voice recognition?

2️⃣2️⃣ Which Azure AI service specializes in translating text into multiple languages?

2️⃣3️⃣ Which Responsible AI principle promotes designing systems that everyone can use effectively?

  • A. Inclusiveness
  • B. Reliability & Safety
  • C. Privacy & Security
  • D. Accountability

2️⃣4️⃣ What is the primary concern addressed by the Privacy & Security principle?

  • A. Ensuring models update automatically.
  • B. Protecting user data and controlling access.
  • C. Maximizing system uptime.
  • D. Reducing compute costs.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Protecting user data and controlling access.
Explanation: Privacy & Security ensures sensitive information is safeguarded throughout the AI lifecycle. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣5️⃣ Which action helps mitigate bias in AI systems?

  • A. Ignoring edge cases during testing.
  • B. Gathering diverse and representative training data.
  • C. Limiting the size of the training dataset.
  • D. Disabling model monitoring features.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Gathering diverse and representative training data.
Explanation: Balanced datasets reduce the risk of biased predictions that favor one group over another. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣6️⃣ What is a benefit of using cloud-based AI services?

  • B. They automatically build business strategies.

  • D. They only support on-premises deployments.

2️⃣7️⃣ How does AI enhance Internet of Things (IoT) solutions?

  • D. By disabling device connectivity.

2️⃣8️⃣ Which practice supports the Reliability & Safety principle in AI systems?

  • D. Allowing models to update without review.

✅ Correct Answer: B — Continuously testing models against real-world scenarios.
Explanation: Ongoing testing ensures AI systems behave predictably and safely once deployed. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣9️⃣ Which example illustrates sentiment analysis?

  • C. Detecting fraudulent transactions.
  • D. Classifying images of animals.

3️⃣0️⃣ Why is data labeling important when training supervised learning models?

Natural Language Processing

Assess your understanding of Azure AI services that analyze and generate language.

1️⃣ Which Azure AI service provides prebuilt capabilities for sentiment analysis and entity recognition?

  • A. Azure AI Language
  • B. Azure Cognitive Search
  • C. Azure Form Recognizer
  • D. Azure Synapse Analytics

2️⃣ What is a primary benefit of using Azure OpenAI Service for conversational bots?

  • B. Large language models that can follow instructions and maintain context
  • C. Built-in speech recognition
  • D. Visual anomaly detection

✅ Correct Answer: B — Large language models that can follow instructions and maintain context.

3️⃣ Which feature of Language Studio lets you build a custom text classification model without writing code?

  • A. Custom Named Entity Recognition
  • B. Conversational Language Understanding
  • C. Question Answering
  • D. Orchestration workflow
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Conversational Language Understanding.
Explanation: Conversational Language Understanding allows you to label intents and entities via a visual interface, creating custom models for natural language input. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

4️⃣ When integrating Azure Cognitive Search with language models, what role does the search index play?

  • A. It generates responses directly.
  • B. It provides grounding documents that the model can reference.
  • C. It trains the model weights.
  • D. It converts audio to text.
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — It provides grounding documents that the model can reference.
Explanation: Azure Cognitive Search retrieves relevant content, which can then be passed to a language model to ground generated answers in trusted data. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

5️⃣ Which capability ensures that a multilingual chatbot built on Azure can detect the language of incoming messages automatically?

  • C. Translator custom glossaries

Responsible AI

Review the principles, tools, and governance practices that ensure AI solutions remain trustworthy.

1️⃣ Which Microsoft Responsible AI principle focuses on protecting personal data and privacy?

  • A. Fairness
  • B. Reliability & Safety
  • C. Privacy & Security
  • D. Inclusiveness
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: C — Privacy & Security.
Explanation: The Privacy & Security principle emphasizes safeguarding data and ensuring AI systems protect sensitive information. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

2️⃣ What is the purpose of an impact assessment in Responsible AI governance?

  • A. To measure model accuracy
  • B. To document potential harms, mitigations, and accountability
  • C. To select cloud regions for deployment
  • D. To configure monitoring alerts
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — To document potential harms, mitigations, and accountability.
Explanation: Impact assessments capture the societal and ethical considerations of an AI system, guiding responsible deployment decisions. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

3️⃣ Which Azure service helps detect and mitigate bias in machine learning models?

  • A. Azure Machine Learning responsible AI dashboard
  • B. Azure Monitor
  • C. Azure Key Vault
  • D. Azure Policy
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: A — Azure Machine Learning responsible AI dashboard.
Explanation: The responsible AI dashboard provides fairness, interpretability, and error analysis tools to identify and reduce bias in models. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

4️⃣ Which practice ensures users understand how AI-driven decisions are made?

  • A. Using black-box models
  • B. Providing transparency and interpretability reports
  • C. Encrypting all data
  • D. Deploying to multiple regions
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Providing transparency and interpretability reports.
Explanation: Transparency requires sharing explanations, documentation, and communication so stakeholders understand model outputs and limitations. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

5️⃣ How can you maintain Responsible AI standards after deploying a model?

  • A. Disable logging to protect privacy
  • B. Establish continuous monitoring and human oversight
  • C. Remove the impact assessment
  • D. Only allow autonomous retraining
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: B — Establish continuous monitoring and human oversight.
Explanation: Ongoing monitoring with human-in-the-loop review catches drifts, anomalies, and policy violations, keeping the solution aligned with Responsible AI commitments. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

  • B. Speech translation
  • C. Neural Text-to-Speech
  • D. Custom Neural Voice

3️⃣ Which capability lets you build a branded synthetic voice using your own recordings?

4️⃣ When should you use the batch transcription API instead of real-time speech-to-text?

  • A. For conversations that need speaker diarization
  • B. For streaming voice commands in an app
  • C. For low-latency transcription in a call center
  • D. For summarizing recorded meetings stored in Azure Blob Storage
Show Answer
✅ Correct Answer: D — For summarizing recorded meetings stored in Azure Blob Storage.
Explanation: Batch transcription handles large prerecorded files asynchronously, ideal for archived meeting recordings. Learn more in the Microsoft documentation.

5️⃣ Which security feature helps prevent unauthorized use of a custom voice model?
